Class LanguageController

  • java.lang.Object
    • LanguageController
  • public class LanguageController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the language change functionality for a game of TicTacToe. It also is responsible for the language Strings and to return them correctly. The two languages to chose from are english and german. It can switch between the two languages by changing a boolean. The language is set by default to english.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Yves Br√§ndli, Nadine Moser, Robin Meier

        public java.lang.String translatePlayerText​(int player)
        translates the Strings Player.
        Parameters:
        player - to indicated which player's turn it is.
        Returns:
        a String for the players in the selected language.

      • translateWelcomeText

        public java.lang.String translateWelcomeText​(java.lang.String player)
        Translates a Welcome message.
        Parameters:
        player - to indicate which player is making the first move.
        Returns:
        a welcome message in the selected language.

      • translateLanguageChangeRequestText

        public java.lang.String translateLanguageChangeRequestText()
        Translates a Language Request message.
        Returns:
        a String with the question to change the language in the selected language.

      • translateLanguageChangeText

        public java.lang.String translateLanguageChangeText()
        Translates a Language change message.
        Returns:
        a message in the selected language, that the language change was successful.

      • translateMoveRequestText

        public java.lang.String translateMoveRequestText​(java.lang.String player)
        Translates a Move Request message.
        Parameters:
        player - indicates, which player should make the next move.
        Returns:
        a call for the move of the next player.

      • translateCurrentGameStateText

        public java.lang.String translateCurrentGameStateText​(int currentGameState)
        Translates current Game State message.
        Parameters:
        currentGameState - indicates which state the gameboard currently has. 1 stands for draw, 2 stands for player one is winning, 3 stands for player two is winning.
        Returns:
        a message with the current winning or draw states.

      • translateWrongMoveText

        public java.lang.String translateWrongMoveText()
        Translates wrong move message.
        Returns:
        a message to chose another move in the selected language.
